channel.title: Brand New Servers need help! (didn't know where to put this)
channel.description:
Hey, Thank you for viewing this request,
Basically we are looking for a full time developer who is interested in programming our server from the floor, We believe strongly in player decisions and have setup polls for players to choose the base they would like, so far the votes are 474, so the Developer would need to be able to program that Revision, We are not using stolen sources, leeched bases or anything that has already been done,
We are doing everything from scratch. So your probably thinking "[B]Amateurs who don't have a clue[/B]" well that's called personal opinion but I can fully assure you we are not, We've been thinking of this server for the past 7 months but haven't taken the courage to actually bring it to life, but over the past last week we've made that dream a reality.
We're offering a Server with,
[ul][*]A steady Community with a diverse Economy, [*].com IDN and Host gator Hosting, Whilst running a SMF 2.0 RC3 Forum ([B]none of that rubbish Keygen, Vbulletin rubbish[/B]) [*]Full Player opinions on everything, the players make the decisions. [*]A strictly no nonsense community. [*]Virtual Private Servers already including a 2GB VPS, WIth possible shares in a 60GB VPS Hosting. [*]Hopefully Fully Integrated SQL Data basing. [*] a 17% Share in all incomes as Developer. [*] Experienced Website Designers and possible Candidates for more Website Designers.[/ul]
Thats only the tip of the iceberg, we are a brand new Community looking to expand as well, So anyone who would like to join our Community head on over to * Please join, please help us grow and develop our Community :thumbup: If you would Like to join and your a experienced RSPS Developer then please register on the Forums and check the "[B]Developer Board[/B]" with Applications and Instructions.
Thank you for reading and I hope we can do some good buisness for the many years ahead.
Also please once registered head over the Development board and fill in your applications, do not apply in a reply here.
*

item.title: Brand New Servers need help! (didn't know where to put this)
item.dc:creator: @JamieWentBeserk JamieWentBeserk
item.description:
@JamieWentBeserk wrote:

[quote=“Liquid Magic, post:17, topic:365546”]I guess I’ll start off with my engine that I’ve been progressively building for the past couple of weeks. Although, I haven’t really gotten the chance to touch it, in a while.

Here’s some pictures of my forum engine:

http://img295.imageshack.us/img295/4942/20336533.png
http://img233.imageshack.us/img233/383/16675767.png
http://img525.imageshack.us/img525/8092/93381361.png
http://img253.imageshack.us/img253/9404/60455200.png

Besides that, I don’t know what else to show you.
Here’s a simple registration process that I wrote up yesterday:

[code]

<?php
/*
#############################################

Efficient Registration Checker and Proccessor

Credits:-Me----------------------------------

#############################################
*/
// Easier for editing - set to default
$host = localhost; // Default
$database = root; // Your databases name
$database_user = root; // Your database password
$database_password = admin; // Your database password

    // Connect to database && MySQL processing
    $connect =  mysql_connect("$host", "$database", "$database_password") or die(mysql_error());
    mysql_select_db("$database_user") or die(mysql_error());
   
    // If we connected successfully
    if ( $connect == true ) {
                   
            // Retrieve the information we've submitted from the form
            #####We've stripped HTML and SCRIPT tags from all fields for security issues#####
            $submit = strip_tags($_POST['submit']); // Calling $submit to take place for $_POST['submit']
            $username = strip_tags($_POST['username']); // Calling $username to take place for $_POST['username']
            $password = strip_tags($_POST['password']); // Calling $password to take place for $_POST['password']
            $v_password = strip_tags($_POST['v_password']); // Password validation
            $email = strip_tags($_POST['email']); // Calling $email to take place for $_POST['email']
            $v_email = strip_tags($_POST['v_email']); // Email validation
            $date = date("m-d-Y"); // Example: 01-01-2010 - MM-DD-YYYY
           
            // Send the user a lovely message
            $errorMessage = "<center><strong>There was an error while trying to process your registration form, please recheck all the fields, and try again.</strong></center><p></p>";
           
            // If the user has pressed the submit button
            if ( $submit == true ) {
           
                    // Select our table and the field name, in this case, it's the field username
                    $c_user = mysql_query("SELECT username FROM users WHERE username='$username'");
                    // We're giving $id_u equal to numrows function, which has its query as c_user, which we declared before this
                    $id_u = mysql_num_rows($c_user);       
                   
                    // If there is an existing username matching the user's typed in username
                    if ( $id_u != 0 ) {
                   
                            echo "<center>That username is taken.</center>";
                   
                    // If the username is not taken...
                    } else {
                   
                            // Checks if no username OR password was entered, then it will select one or the other
                            if ( ( !$username ) || ( !$password ) || ( !$v_password ) || ( !$email ) || ( !$v_email ) ) {
                                   
                                    // Display default error message
                                    echo $errorMessage;
                                    // If no username was entered
                                    if ( !$username ) {       
                                            echo "<center>Please enter a username.</center>";
                                    }
                                    // If no password was entered
                                    if ( !$password ) {                               
                                            echo "<center>Please enter a password.</center>";
                                    }
                                    // If no confirmation password was entered
                                    if ( !$v_password ) {
                                            echo "<center>Please re-enter your password.</center>";
                                    }
                                    // If no email address was entered
                                    if ( !$email ) {
                                            echo "<center>Please enter your email address.</center>";
                                    }
                                    // If no confirmation email was entered
                                    if ( !$v_email ) {
                                            echo "<center>Please re-enter your email address.</center>";
                                    }
                            // If everything succeeds so far...
                            } else {
                                    #####Now we're going to check for length issues#####
                                   
                                    // Will select any of the given statements in the code blocks - highly efficient method
                                    if ( strlen( $username ) >= 26 || strlen( $username ) <=2 || strlen( $password ) >= 26 || strlen( $password ) <= 2 || strlen( $email ) <= 4 || strlen( $email ) >=51 ) {
                                           
                                            // Display default error message
                                            echo $errorMessage;
                                           
                                            // If the entered username is greater than or equal to twenty-six characters (less than 25)
                                            if ( strlen( $username ) >= 26 ) {
                                                    echo "<center>Username max limit is 25 characters!</center>";
                                            }
                                           
                                            // If the entered username is less than or equal to two characters (greater than 2)
                                            if ( strlen( $username ) <= 2 ) {
                                                    echo "<center>Username must be at least 3 characters long!</center>";
                                            }
                                           
                                            // If the entered password is greater than or equal to twenty-six characters (less than 25)
                                            if ( strlen( $password ) >= 26 ) {
                                                    echo "<center>Password max limit is 25 characters!</center>";
                                            }
                                           
                                            // If the entered password is less than or equal to two characters (greater than 2)
                                            if ( strlen( $password ) <= 2 ) {
                                                    echo "<center>Password must be at least 3 characters long!</center>";
                                            }       
                                            // If the entered email is greater than or equal to twenty-six characters (less than 50)
                                            if ( strlen( $password ) >= 51 ) {
                                                    echo "<center>Email address max limit is 50 characters!</center>";
                                            }
                                           
                                            // If the entered email is less than or equal to two characters (greater than 5)
                                            if ( strlen( $email ) <= 4 ) {
                                                    echo "<center>Email address must be at least 5 characters long!</center>";
                                            }
                                    } else {
                                            #####Now we're going to check for matching variable characters for passwords and email addresses#####
                                           
                                            // Extremely stable statements
                                            if ( $password != $v_password || $v_password != $password || $email != $v_email || $v_email != $email  ) {
                                                    echo $errorMessage;
                                                   
                                                    // If the user's password is not equal to the confirmation form for the user's password, or the other way around
                                                    if ( $password != $v_password || $v_password != $password ) {
                                                            echo "<center>Your passwords do not match.</center>";
                                                    }
                                                   
                                                    // If the user's email is not equal to the confirmation form for the user's email, or the other way around
                                                    if ( $email != $v_email || $v_email != $email ) {
                                                            echo "<center>Your email addresses do not match.</center>";
                                                    }
                                            // If everything succeeds so far...
                                            } else {
                                                    #####Let's finally insert some data!#####
                                                   
                                                    // Hash
                                                    $salt = "aE4sk85HslOp19ko1J8k3MN1m";
                                                    $password = sha1($salt.$password);
                                                    $v_password = sha1($salt.$v_password);
                                                   
                                                    // You might have to take out some of those, because my table includes a bit more than yours might
                                                    $query = mysql_query("INSERT INTO users VALUES ('', '$username', '$password', '$email', '$date', '0', '');");
                                                    echo "<center>Success!</center>";
                                            }
                                    }
                            }
                    }
            }
           
            // Display our form
            echo "
                    <center>
                            <form action='register.php' method='post'>
                                    <strong>Username: </strong><input type='text' name='username' /><br /><br />
                                    <strong>Password: </strong><input type='password' name='password' /><br />
                                    <strong>Confirm Password: </strong><input type='password' name='v_password' /><br /><br />
                                    <strong>Email Address: </strong><input type=text' name='email' /><br />
                                    <strong>Confirm Email Address: </strong><input type=text' name='v_email' /><br /><br />
                                    <input type='submit' name='submit' value='Submit' />
                            </form>
                    </center>       
            ";
   
    } else {
            echo "<center>There was a problem connecting.</center>";
    }

?>
[/code][/quote]

Can you add JamiesJustPro@hotmail.co.uk thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Brand New Servers need help! (didn't know where to put this)
item.dc:creator: @Liquid_Magic Liquid Magic
item.description:
@Liquid_Magic wrote:

I guess I’ll start off with my engine that I’ve been progressively building for the past couple of weeks. Although, I haven’t really gotten the chance to touch it, in a while.

Here’s some pictures of my forum engine:

http://img295.imageshack.us/img295/4942/20336533.png
http://img233.imageshack.us/img233/383/16675767.png
http://img525.imageshack.us/img525/8092/93381361.png
http://img253.imageshack.us/img253/9404/60455200.png

Besides that, I don’t know what else to show you.
Here’s a simple registration process that I wrote up yesterday:

<?php       
/*
#############################################
=============================================
Efficient Registration Checker and Proccessor
---------------------------------------------
Credits:-Me----------------------------------
=============================================
#############################################
*/               
        // Easier for editing - set to default
        $host = localhost; // Default
        $database = root; // Your databases name
        $database_user = root; // Your database password
        $database_password = admin; // Your database password
       
        // Connect to database && MySQL processing
        $connect =  mysql_connect("$host", "$database", "$database_password") or die(mysql_error());
        mysql_select_db("$database_user") or die(mysql_error());
       
        // If we connected successfully
        if ( $connect == true ) {
                       
                // Retrieve the information we've submitted from the form
                #####We've stripped HTML and SCRIPT tags from all fields for security issues#####
                $submit = strip_tags($_POST['submit']); // Calling $submit to take place for $_POST['submit']
                $username = strip_tags($_POST['username']); // Calling $username to take place for $_POST['username']
                $password = strip_tags($_POST['password']); // Calling $password to take place for $_POST['password']
                $v_password = strip_tags($_POST['v_password']); // Password validation
                $email = strip_tags($_POST['email']); // Calling $email to take place for $_POST['email']
                $v_email = strip_tags($_POST['v_email']); // Email validation
                $date = date("m-d-Y"); // Example: 01-01-2010 - MM-DD-YYYY
               
                // Send the user a lovely message
                $errorMessage = "<center><strong>There was an error while trying to process your registration form, please recheck all the fields, and try again.</strong></center><p></p>";
               
                // If the user has pressed the submit button
                if ( $submit == true ) {
               
                        // Select our table and the field name, in this case, it's the field username
                        $c_user = mysql_query("SELECT username FROM users WHERE username='$username'");
                        // We're giving $id_u equal to numrows function, which has its query as c_user, which we declared before this
                        $id_u = mysql_num_rows($c_user);       
                       
                        // If there is an existing username matching the user's typed in username
                        if ( $id_u != 0 ) {
                       
                                echo "<center>That username is taken.</center>";
                       
                        // If the username is not taken...
                        } else {
                       
                                // Checks if no username OR password was entered, then it will select one or the other
                                if ( ( !$username ) || ( !$password ) || ( !$v_password ) || ( !$email ) || ( !$v_email ) ) {
                                       
                                        // Display default error message
                                        echo $errorMessage;
                                        // If no username was entered
                                        if ( !$username ) {       
                                                echo "<center>Please enter a username.</center>";
                                        }
                                        // If no password was entered
                                        if ( !$password ) {                               
                                                echo "<center>Please enter a password.</center>";
                                        }
                                        // If no confirmation password was entered
                                        if ( !$v_password ) {
                                                echo "<center>Please re-enter your password.</center>";
                                        }
                                        // If no email address was entered
                                        if ( !$email ) {
                                                echo "<center>Please enter your email address.</center>";
                                        }
                                        // If no confirmation email was entered
                                        if ( !$v_email ) {
                                                echo "<center>Please re-enter your email address.</center>";
                                        }
                                // If everything succeeds so far...
                                } else {
                                        #####Now we're going to check for length issues#####
                                       
                                        // Will select any of the given statements in the code blocks - highly efficient method
                                        if ( strlen( $username ) >= 26 || strlen( $username ) <=2 || strlen( $password ) >= 26 || strlen( $password ) <= 2 || strlen( $email ) <= 4 || strlen( $email ) >=51 ) {
                                               
                                                // Display default error message
                                                echo $errorMessage;
                                               
                                                // If the entered username is greater than or equal to twenty-six characters (less than 25)
                                                if ( strlen( $username ) >= 26 ) {
                                                        echo "<center>Username max limit is 25 characters!</center>";
                                                }
                                               
                                                // If the entered username is less than or equal to two characters (greater than 2)
                                                if ( strlen( $username ) <= 2 ) {
                                                        echo "<center>Username must be at least 3 characters long!</center>";
                                                }
                                               
                                                // If the entered password is greater than or equal to twenty-six characters (less than 25)
                                                if ( strlen( $password ) >= 26 ) {
                                                        echo "<center>Password max limit is 25 characters!</center>";
                                                }
                                               
                                                // If the entered password is less than or equal to two characters (greater than 2)
                                                if ( strlen( $password ) <= 2 ) {
                                                        echo "<center>Password must be at least 3 characters long!</center>";
                                                }       
                                                // If the entered email is greater than or equal to twenty-six characters (less than 50)
                                                if ( strlen( $password ) >= 51 ) {
                                                        echo "<center>Email address max limit is 50 characters!</center>";
                                                }
                                               
                                                // If the entered email is less than or equal to two characters (greater than 5)
                                                if ( strlen( $email ) <= 4 ) {
                                                        echo "<center>Email address must be at least 5 characters long!</center>";
                                                }
                                        } else {
                                                #####Now we're going to check for matching variable characters for passwords and email addresses#####
                                               
                                                // Extremely stable statements
                                                if ( $password != $v_password || $v_password != $password || $email != $v_email || $v_email != $email  ) {
                                                        echo $errorMessage;
                                                       
                                                        // If the user's password is not equal to the confirmation form for the user's password, or the other way around
                                                        if ( $password != $v_password || $v_password != $password ) {
                                                                echo "<center>Your passwords do not match.</center>";
                                                        }
                                                       
                                                        // If the user's email is not equal to the confirmation form for the user's email, or the other way around
                                                        if ( $email != $v_email || $v_email != $email ) {
                                                                echo "<center>Your email addresses do not match.</center>";
                                                        }
                                                // If everything succeeds so far...
                                                } else {
                                                        #####Let's finally insert some data!#####
                                                       
                                                        // Hash
                                                        $salt = "aE4sk85HslOp19ko1J8k3MN1m";
                                                        $password = sha1($salt.$password);
                                                        $v_password = sha1($salt.$v_password);
                                                       
                                                        // You might have to take out some of those, because my table includes a bit more than yours might
                                                        $query = mysql_query("INSERT INTO users VALUES ('', '$username', '$password', '$email', '$date', '0', '');");
                                                        echo "<center>Success!</center>";
                                                }
                                        }
                                }
                        }
                }
               
                // Display our form
                echo "
                        <center>
                                <form action='register.php' method='post'>
                                        <strong>Username: </strong><input type='text' name='username' /><br /><br />
                                        <strong>Password: </strong><input type='password' name='password' /><br />
                                        <strong>Confirm Password: </strong><input type='password' name='v_password' /><br /><br />
                                        <strong>Email Address: </strong><input type=text' name='email' /><br />
                                        <strong>Confirm Email Address: </strong><input type=text' name='v_email' /><br /><br />
                                        <input type='submit' name='submit' value='Submit' />
                                </form>
                        </center>       
                ";
       
        } else {
                echo "<center>There was a problem connecting.</center>";
        }
?>

item.title: Brand New Servers need help! (didn't know where to put this)
item.dc:creator: @JamieWentBeserk JamieWentBeserk
item.description:
@JamieWentBeserk wrote:

Hey, Thank you for viewing this request,

Basically we are looking for a full time developer who is interested in programming our server from the floor, We believe strongly in player decisions and have setup polls for players to choose the base they would like, so far the votes are 474, so the Developer would need to be able to program that Revision, We are not using stolen sources, leeched bases or anything that has already been done,

We are doing everything from scratch. So your probably thinking “Amateurs who don’t have a clue” well that’s called personal opinion but I can fully assure you we are not, We’ve been thinking of this server for the past 7 months but haven’t taken the courage to actually bring it to life, but over the past last week we’ve made that dream a reality.

We’re offering a Server with,

[ul][]A steady Community with a diverse Economy,
[].com IDN and Host gator Hosting, Whilst running a SMF 2.0 RC3 Forum (none of that rubbish Keygen, Vbulletin rubbish)
[]Full Player opinions on everything, the players make the decisions.
[]A strictly no nonsense community.
[]Virtual Private Servers already including a 2GB VPS, WIth possible shares in a 60GB VPS Hosting.
[]Hopefully Fully Integrated SQL Data basing.
[] a 17% Share in all incomes as Developer.
[] Experienced Website Designers and possible Candidates for more Website Designers.[/ul]

Thats only the tip of the iceberg, we are a brand new Community looking to expand as well, So anyone who would like to join our Community head on over to * Please join, please help us grow and develop our Community :thumbup: If you would Like to join and your a experienced RSPS Developer then please register on the Forums and check the “Developer Board” with Applications and Instructions.

Thank you for reading and I hope we can do some good buisness for the many years ahead.

Also please once registered head over the Development board and fill in your applications, do not apply in a reply here.

Read full topic
item.source: Brand New Servers need help! (didn't know where to put this)
